# Draft:Mike Hickingbottom

|birth_place=Calipatria, California, U.S.|Best_Cup_Pos=119th (1990)|Total_ARCA_West_Races=6|Years_In_ARCA_West=2|Best_ARCA_West_Pos=16th (1990)|First_ARCA_West_Race=1989 Motorcraft 500 (Evergreen)|Last_ARCA_West_Race=1990 Six Rivers National Bank 200 (Redwood Acres)|ARCA_West_Wins=0|ARCA_West_Top_Tens=0|ARCA_West_Poles=0|updated=April 4, 2025}}
Michael "Mike" Hickingbottom (born January 31, 1957) is an American former professional stock car racing driver. He competed in the NASCAR Winston Cup Series, NASCAR Winston West Series, and NASCAR Featherlite Southwest Tour.
Racing career
NASCAR Winston Cup Series
Hickingbottom attempted to make the 1990 Banquet Frozen Foods 300, a combination race with the Winston West Series, but failed to qualify.
NASCAR Winston West Series
Hickingbottom made his NASCAR Winston West Series debut at Evergreen Speedway in 1989, finishing 22nd after oil line issues took him out of the race. He attempted the first six races of the 1990 season, failing to qualify for the combination race at Sears Point International Raceway and scoring a best finish of 12th at Saugus Speedway, the only race in which he was running at the finish.
NASCAR Featherlite Southwest Tour
Hickingottom competed in 4 NASCAR Featherlite Southwest Tour races in 1988, as well as attempting 8 others. He scored a best finish of 22nd at Sears Point International Raceway.
